word_mean: 夹竹桃：一种有毒的夹竹桃科常绿灌木，其根、花、子实和皮均含有强心甙

sentence.Network_en: The Hibiscus, Azalea and Oleander are some common shrubs.
sentence.Network_cn: 大红花, 杜鹃和夹竹桃是一些常见的灌木.

sentence.Network_en: We can see them from spring to autumn . The whole plant of the Oleander is poisonous.
sentence.Network_cn: 从春天到夏天我们都能看到夹竹桃. 夹竹桃全身都有毒.

sentence.Network_en: Many Sri Lankans kill themselves by eating the seeds of the yellow oleander, a common shrub.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多斯里兰卡人就是通过吃黄色夹竹桃(一种普通的灌木)的种子丢掉自己的性命.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from medieval Latin, of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: An oleander is an evergreen tree or shrub that has white, pink, or purple flowers. Oleanders grow in Mediterranean countries and in some parts of Asia and Australia.

means.word_mean: 1. an ornamental but poisonous flowering shrub having narrow evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant white to pink or red flowers: native to East Indies but widely cultivated in warm regions

auth_sentence.content: There's a patio and a roof terrace and a huge garden of palm trees, pine, mimosa, oleander and bougainvillea.
